template: {{payload.title}}

name: Next image url
Frame grabber
info:
This section of the flow is responsible for 
grabbing a single out of the RTSP feed of the IP
Camera. It uses avconv to do that which is part
of the libav-tools for raspberry pi.

The trigger can be an inject, or a UI button.
The statistic node keeps a track of the number of
grabbed frames and the success rate (when the
video conversion/grabbing was successful). The 
Statistic node also has a reset input which can 
be used to periodically reset the stats (e.g.
daily, weekly).

I directed the second output of the Exec node to
a file, as the output of the avconv is usually 
quite long and if there are errors you don't
see the entire output in the debug window, so in
that case just open to output and see what the issue
is.

ffmpeg -f rtsp -i "rtsp://admin:admin@192.168.43.1:8080/h264_pcm.sdp" -f image2pipe pipe:1

name: function 1
Clock Toolbar
format:
<script id="titleScript" type="text/javascript">

$(function() {
    if($('.md-toolbar-tools').length != 0){
        loadClock();
    }else setTimeout(loadClock, 500)
});

function loadClock(){
    $('#clock').remove();
    var toolbar = $('.md-toolbar-tools');
    
    var div = $('<div/>');
    var p = $('<p/ id="clock">');
    
    div.append(p);
    div[0].style.margin = '5px 5px 5px auto';
    toolbar.append(div);

    function displayTitle(lh) {
        p.text(lh); 
    }
    
    function upTime() {
        var d = new Date();
        p.text(d.toLocaleString());
    }

    if(document.clockInterval){ 
            clearInterval(document.clockInterval);
            document.clockInterval = null;
    }
        
    document.clockInterval = setInterval(upTime,1000);
}

</script>

name: Dashboard Theme : Modern Dark
info:
# Modern Dark Theme for node-red-dashboard

Inspired by Victor Lucachi with his [Node Red Dashboard Concept](https://dribbble.com/shots/10356530-Node-Red-Dashboard-Concept) on Dribbble. Thank you for your work.

## Customize

1. Go on dashboard customisation tab (At the right of Debug Console).
2. Select the style `Dark`.
3. Pick the color you want. Example `#66B5F8`

## Buttons

Use `2x2` size for buttons with icon and text on the screenshot

name: File Browser
info:
1) Update the default folder in the Init node
2) Update the default folder in the Reset node as well
3) You can duplicate the Reset nodes and use them as saved shortcuts
4) Check the Convert Timestamps function node if you want to see your dates in a different format. I just used the Javascript toISOString format.
5) The Graph button can read any CSV file which have any number of values, but the first column always contains a timestamp column with javascript timestamp of the data point.

name: Function
func:
d = new Date,
dformat = [d.getMonth()+1,
    d.getDate(),
    d.getFullYear()].join('/')+' '+
    [d.getHours(),
    d.getMinutes(),
    d.getSeconds()].join(':');

dtstmp = new Date().toString();
pld =       "UPDATE [Dev].[dbo].[MQTTData] "
pld = pld + "Set Timestamp = '" + dformat + "' "
pld = pld + "WHERE id = 1"

msg.payload = pld
return msg;

name: Function
func:
pld =       "SELECT ID, Topic, Payload, Timestamp "
pld = pld + "FROM [Dev].[dbo].[MQTTData] "
pld = pld + "WHERE id = " + msg.payload

msg.payload = pld
return msg;

name: Function
func:
d = new Date(),
dformat = [d.getMonth()+1,
    d.getDate(),
    d.getFullYear()].join('/')+' '+
    [d.getHours(),
    d.getMinutes(),
    d.getSeconds()].join(':');

pld =       "INSERT INTO [Dev].[dbo].[MQTTData] "
pld = pld + "(Topic, Payload, Timestamp) "
pld = pld + "VALUES ('" + msg.topic + "', '" + msg.payload + "', '" + dformat + "')"

msg.topic = ''
msg.payload = pld
return msg;

function 4

ConvertArr
Change range
Chart line1
Chart line2
12 month random
func:
var tempData = []
const months = [
    "Jan",
    "Feb",
    "Mar",
    "Apr",
    "May",
    "Jun",
    "July",
    "Aug",
    "Sep",
    "Oct",
    "Nov",
    "Dec"
]

for (i = 0 ; i < months.length; i++)
{
    const dataSet = {
        "temp" : Math.random() * 30,
        "month" : months[i]
    }
    tempData.push(dataSet)
}
msg.payload = tempData
return msg;
